alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Buckingham; Campbell; Charlotte; Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 9:19PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Showers and thunderstorms capable of producing gusty winds will impact portions of Appomattox, Charlotte, Campbell, northern Pittsylvania, northern Halifax, and southeastern Buckingham Counties through 1000 PM EST... At 916 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking widespread showers and thunderstorms falling across much of Central and Southside Virginia. The strongest thunderstorms were located along a line from Altavista, to Gretna, to near Callands. Movement was northeastward at speeds in excess of 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Altavista... Appomattox... Hurt... Chatham... Gretna... Brookneal... and Keysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Additional statements will be issued as conditions warrant.
